body.p: Western Political Science Association (WPSA) President Peregrine Schwartz-Shea has announced the formation of a search committee to recommend the selection of a new editor or editors for the Political Research Quarterly (PRQ). The term of the current editors, Cornell Clayton and Amy Mazur, will expire on June 30, 2014. The association is seeking nominations of qualified individuals who would edit the journal from July 1, 2014, through June 30, 2018. This four-year term is renewable for a two-year optional extension. Nominations and self-nominations are both welcome. The WPSA encourages nominations of women and members of ethnic minorities.

sec.title: About PRQ
sec.p: PRQ is a refereed scholarly journal publishing original research in all areas of political science. Published quarterly in association with the WPSA, PRQ is one of the top ranked journals in the field. The journal publishes scholarly research of exceptionally high merit that covers the entire range of topics and subjects in political science, including the following:

The editors are responsible for the substantive content of the journal. This includes, but is not limited to, advancing the journal’s mission and reputation, soliciting articles, overseeing the peer review process, working with authors, consulting with and managing the editorial board, and collaborating with the publisher to increase the journal’s visibility and readership. The new editors are encouraged to continue the journal’s efforts to reflect the methodological and theoretical diversity of the discipline, and to serve the full range of political science scholars.

sec.title: PRQ and the WPSA
sec.p: PRQ, formerly the Western Political Quarterly, has been owned and published by the University of Utah since 1948. Since 1971, it has been a cooperative endeavor between the University of Utah and the WPSA. The Memorandum of Understanding governing this cooperative effort may be obtained by contacting Bill Haltom (haltom@pugetsound.edu) or Richard Clucas (hprc@pdx.edu). Since 2007, SAGE has served as the publisher of the journal.

sec.title: Financial Arrangements
sec.p: Historically, editors of the PRQ have received support both from the University of Utah, owner of the PRQ, and the editors’ home institution. Support from the home institution has typically included graduate assistant support, reduced teaching assignment, clerical support, office space, and operational funds. Editorial subvention from the PRQ (University of Utah) is provided to the editors. Annually, the editors provide an invoice outlining their intended use for the subvention. Expenses have typically included PRQ-related travel, office supplies, reception at conferences, telecommunications, postage, and editorial assistants. Copy editing and printing are handled by SAGE.

Contact Bill Haltom (haltom@pugetsound.edu) or Richard Clucas (hprc@pdx.edu) for information on the subvention amount and other financial matters. Further information about the operation of PRQ and the search is available on the WPSA website: http://wpsa.research.pdx.edu/pub/PRQ.php
Candidates are also welcome to communicate directly with the current editors, Cornell Clayton (cwclayton@wsu.edu) and Amy Mazur (Mazur@wsu.edu).

sec.title: Application Process
sec.p: Applications must be accompanied by the following:

list-item.p: a candidate’s letter expressing his or her goals for the journal, including any proposed changes to the journal
a letter from the appropriate administrative office of the nominee’s university, at the level of Dean or above, indicating that institution’s willingness to commit appropriate support

sec.p: Given the broad range of topics and subjects published in the journal, candidates are encouraged to consider submitting proposals for joint or team editorships, including collaborating with colleagues across universities.

For full consideration, please submit nominations by May 15, 2013, when the committee will begin its review. Please email all application materials to Committee Chair William Haltom at haltom@pugetsound.edu and WPSA Executive Director Richard Clucas at hprc@pdx.edu.

It is anticipated that the selection of the new editors will be made in September 2013 during the annual meeting of the American Political Science Association in Chicago, IL. Finalist interviews will be held early during the APSA meetings, and a final decision will be made by the WPSA Executive Committee.
